title: Rabies scare in UP: 'Raita' made from dog-bitten buffalo‚Äôs milk sends 200 to hospital
content: Nearly 200 residents of Piprauli village in Uttar Pradesh received anti-rabies vaccinations as a precaution after consuming raita made from the milk of a buffalo that later died of suspected rabies. The buffalo had reportedly been bitten by a rabid dog, prompting health officials to administer vaccines to prevent any potential risk, though no disease has spread so far.

title: ‚ÄòAn apple a day‚Äô ‚Äî but at what cost? Kashmir's orchards raise health alarm
content: Kashmir's apple orchards face scrutiny as lawmakers and medical experts link decades of pesticide use to rising malignant brain tumours among orchard workers. Studies reveal high incidences of brain cancer in fruit-growing districts, with evidence of pesticide residues found in human blood, demanding urgent policy responses for worker safety.

title: How honeymoon in Sri Lanka led to suicide of Bengaluru couple 1,000km apart
content: A 30-year-old man, facing dowry harassment and abetment to suicide charges after his wife's death, died by suicide in a Nagpur hotel. He had fled Bengaluru with his family due to threats from his in-laws. His mother also attempted suicide but survived.

title: 'Kindly relieve me asap': Pharma company finance president resigns over Delhi's toxic air
content: A pharmaceutical company's president of finance resigned citing Delhi's severe air pollution as the reason, highlighting health concerns aggravated by the smog. This incident reflects a growing trend of individuals and families reassessing their lives in the capital due to the worsening environmental crisis, impacting life choices and prompting moves to cleaner environments.

title: Explained: Why Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are not playing VHT matches
content: Delhi are scheduled to take on Saurashtra at the Karnataka Cricket Association (KSCA) Stadium in Alur, while Mumbai will face Chhattisgarh at the Jaipuria Vidyalaya Ground in Jaipur. Both teams will be will be without the services of Kohli and Rohit, who had committed to playing only the first two matches of the competition.

title: US AI race at risk: US risks losing AI race to China - Michael Burry warns America on Nvidia
content: Wall Street titan Michael Burry warns America faces defeat in the AI race against China. He highlights a critical energy production gap, arguing the US reliance on power-hungry Nvidia chips is unsustainable. Burry points to China's accelerating energy growth and infrastructure development, contrasting it with US deceleration due to permitting issues, suggesting a strategic pivot is essential.

title: Watch: Mob storms student‚Äôs party, thrashes Muslim guests for ‚Äòlove jihad‚Äô
content: Right-wing activists disrupted a birthday party in Bareilly, assaulting guests and raising 'love jihad' slogans over the presence of Muslim attendees. Police initially fined victims before registering an FIR against the attackers following social media outrage. Claims of 'love jihad' were found to be untrue.

title: Stocks to buy: What's the outlook for Nifty for this week? Check list of top stocks
content: Stock market recommendations: Sudeep Shah, Head - Technical Research and Derivatives at SBI Securities recommends buying Karur Vysya Bank, and Gujarat Mineral Development Corporation.

title: Beyond the big three - Who can stop the Alcaraz-Sinner takeover?
content: What's on the other side of the court? As the Alcaraz-Sinner duopoly threatens to take over tennis, replacing the famed Big Three, how does the men's game shape up in the New Year...

title: ‚ÄòAI agents are becoming a problem‚Äô: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
content: OpenAI is hiring a Head of Preparedness for $555,000, acknowledging AI's growing ability to find security flaws and impact mental health. CEO Sam Altman revealed models are "beginning to find critical vulnerabilities." The role addresses cybersecurity, biosecurity, and AI's psychological effects, following lawsuits and reports of AI-driven harm. This move signals a significant shift in the company's safety approach.

title: When the brain sees faces everywhere: How visual snow syndrome amplifies pareidolia
content: New research reveals people with visual snow syndrome experience heightened face pareidolia, mistaking everyday objects for faces more frequently. This condition, characterized by constant visual static, is linked to overactive neurons. While migraines can intensify these illusions, coping strategies and treatments aim to manage the overwhelming visual input.

title: Chinese billionaire‚Äôs succession plan: 100+ children already, wants 20 US-born heirs to run gaming firm
content: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children via surrogacy to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune. While his company denies claims of over 100 children, they confirmed 12 were born in the US. This trend echoes similar desires from figures like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk to expand their legacies.

title: Elderly residents trapped: Indonesia's Manado retirement home catches fire; 16 killed
content: Tragedy struck Manado, Indonesia, as a devastating fire at the Werdha Damai retirement home claimed at least 16 lives. Flames engulfed the building late Sunday, trapping many elderly residents. Emergency services responded swiftly, but the blaze left three others with burn injuries. Authorities are now investigating the cause of this horrific incident.

title: 'Still got flight': LeBron James‚Äô unreal dunk vs Kings sends fans wild
content: LeBron James showcased his remarkable dunking prowess against the Sacramento Kings. His skills left fans in awe during his 23rd season. A viral clip captured a spectacular mid-air pass from Marcus Smart to James, who finished with an emphatic dunk. This performance, alongside Luka Doncic, is crucial as the Lakers aim to improve their 19-10 record and recover from recent losses.

title: Delhi AQI crosses 400: Dense fog disrupts flight ops across India
content: Thick smog and fog across northern India have led to significant flight delays, prompting the Ministry of Civil Aviation to issue a travel advisory. Airlines are urging passengers to check flight statuses and allow extra travel time as operations at select airports are impacted by reduced visibility and CAT III conditions.

title: States to gain Rs 17,000 cr under VB - G RAM G? Most will remain net gainers
content: The Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission Act is projected to boost state funds by nearly Rs 17,000 crore, despite concerns over a revised 60:40 Centre-state funding ratio. An SBI report indicates most states will be net gainers, with opportunities to enhance benefits through their own contributions.

title: Tripura student Angel Chakma‚Äôs death: Cops reach Nepal to trace main accused
content: Tripura CM Manik Saha has urged Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami to ensure justice for Anjel Chakma, a 24-year-old MBA student from Tripura who died after a racially motivated assault in Dehradun. Five suspects have been arrested, with authorities now seeking a sixth fugitive in Nepal and offering a reward for information.

title: Battle of the Sexes: An exhibition that helped tennis none; hurt women's sport more
content: The modern 'Battle of the Sexes' exhibition between Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kyrgios was a detrimental circus act for women's tennis. Despite rigged rules, the match highlighted a lack of competitive substance, contrasting sharply with Billie Jean King's impactful 1973 win over Bobby Riggs that shaped the formation of the Women's Tennis Association (WTA) and paved way for equality.

title: Bangladesh polls: Students-led NCP divided over alliance with Jamaat; leaders quit, defections loom
content: The National Citizen Party (NCP), formed by leaders of the '2024 July Uprising,' is facing internal dissent. Thirty members oppose an alliance with Jamaat-e-Islami (JeI) for the upcoming polls due to JeI's controversial history. This has led to resignations, with some members considering rival parties or independent candidacies.

title: Silver's sparkling rally! Spot silver hits record high; surges past $80 an ounce mark
content: Silver prices soared past eighty dollars an ounce on Monday. Tight supplies and growing industrial demand fueled this rally. Platinum also touched a record high. Investors are watching for further US interest rate cuts. Gold prices eased slightly after reaching new highs. Geopolitical developments are also a key focus for traders.

title: 25-year-old air hostess dies during party in Gurgaon
content: A 25-year-old air hostess, Simran Dadwal, died early Sunday morning in Gurugram. She reportedly experienced breathing difficulties at a friend's party. Friends rushed her to a hospital, but she could not be saved. Police are awaiting an autopsy report to determine the cause of death. Her parents have arrived and requested a post-mortem to rule out foul play.

title: Blunt verdict! 'Shubman Gill can't be captain of all formats': Ex-England star explains reasons
content: Monty Panesar‚Äôs remarks come at a time when India have struggled in Test cricket under head coach Gautam Gambhir, with the side suffering two whitewash defeats ‚Äî 3-0 against New Zealand and 2-0 against South Africa. Speaking about Gambhir‚Äôs tenure, Panesar said the former India opener has proven himself as a white-ball coach but still needs time and experience in red-ball cricket.

title: Encroachments on forest land: Stones pelted at cops during protest in Rishikesh
content: Protests erupted in Rishikesh as residents clashed with police and forest officials over a Supreme Court-ordered probe into the lease of reserved forest land. The demonstration, which blocked highways and railway tracks, was triggered by an investigation into the alleged illegal sale of 2,866 acres of government-owned forest land.

title: Andhra Pradesh: 2 train coaches with 158 people catch fire on Ernakulam Express; 1 dead
content: A fire erupted in a coach of the Ernakulam Express early Monday, prompting an immediate halt at Yalamanchili railway station in Andhra Pradesh.  Railway staff swiftly detached unaffected coaches, ensuring all passengers were safely evacuated without injuries. An investigation into the cause of the blaze, which gutted two coaches, is underway.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 26,050; BSE Sensex near 85,100
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 26,050, BSE Sensex was above 85,000.

title: Patrick Mahomes finds inspiration from teen battling rare disease amid recovery
content: Patrick Mahomes received heartfelt encouragement during his ACL recovery from a 14 year old Kansas teen battling Pompe disease. After meeting through Make A Wish, the teen shared words of resilience drawn from his own rehabilitation journey. The exchange offered Mahomes motivation beyond football as he begins a long road back to the field.

title: Ashes: 'Might drop 'very' from 'very good'' ‚Äî Gavaskar after two-day Test at MCG
content: The Melbourne Cricket Ground witnessed an unprecedented two-day Test, sparking outrage over pitch quality.  Batting legend Sunil Gavaskar sarcastically questioned the contrasting ratings of the Perth and Melbourne pitches, highlighting the financial and sporting implications of the rapid finish.  He subtly critiqued the perceived double standards in evaluating groundsmen's work.

title: From jewellery to handbag - South Korea first lady accused of taking bribes over $200,000
content: South Korea's former first lady was alleged by prosecutors Monday to have accepted lavish bribes totalling over $200,000, including fine art, jewellery and a handbag, as well as meddling in state affairs. They alleged that bribes from businesses and politicians received by Kim totalled up to 377.25 million won ($263,000).

title: Watch: TVK chief Vijay trips, falls after being mobbed at Chennai airport
content: Actor-politician Vijay experienced a brief stumble at Chennai airport upon his return from Malaysia, as a surging crowd gathered around him. Security quickly assisted the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam chief, ensuring his safe entry into his car. The incident occurred after his attendance at the audio launch of his purported final film, Jananayagan.

title: Cold wave forces school closures in UP, Bihar, Jharkhand and Himachal
content: A severe cold wave has disrupted normal school schedules across several North Indian states. According to media reports, Uttar Pradesh has ordered the closure of all schools until January 1, 2026, while Bihar and Jharkhand have announced temporary closures with revised timings in some areas. Heavy snowfall has extended winter holidays in Himachal Pradesh. Rajasthan continues scheduled winter vacations, while schools in South and East India remain open with normal classes.

title: Dhruv Rathee responds to Janhvi Kapoor thumbnail backlash
content: A YouTube thumbnail featuring a before-and-after image of Janhvi Kapoor has snowballed into a major social media controversy. The image was used by Dhruv Rathee in his video discussing ‚Äúfake beauty‚Äù and cosmetic procedures, prompting sharp reactions online. Matters escalated when several users alleged that the video was a reaction to Janhvi‚Äôs recent post supporting Bangladeshi Hindus, with timing and visuals fuelling speculation.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd recommends buying Midwest, and Ambuja Cement. An 18% upside is seen in Midwest and a 35% upside in Ambuja Cement.

title: Mexico: 13 killed, over 100 injured after train derails; videos show scenes of chaos
content: A tragic derailment of the Interoceanic Train in southern Mexico has claimed at least 13 lives and injured 98 passengers. The accident occurred near Nizanda, halting vital rail traffic connecting the Pacific and Gulf coasts. Inaugurated last year, the train is a key part of Mexico's ambitious plan to develop the Isthmus of Tehuantepec into a major trade corridor.

title: Puppies burned to death in West Bengal for whimpering in cold
content: Four men allegedly burned five puppies to death in Howrah after being annoyed by their cries in the cold. The mother dog was also injured. Animal lovers have protested, demanding swift punishment for the perpetrators, who are currently at large as police investigate.

title: Nuclear readiness: North Korea tests 2 long-range cruise missiles -- watch
content: North Korea has launched two long-range cruise missiles, showcasing its nuclear combat readiness amid escalating regional tensions. Leader Kim Jong Un oversaw the drill, emphasizing self-defense and deterrence against perceived external threats. This demonstration follows Pyongyang's recent reveal of progress on its first nuclear-powered submarine, further heightening concerns on the Korean Peninsula.

title: 'Jassi bhai itna deep chale gaye': Axar Patel reveals Jasprit Bumrah's perfume obsession
content: Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has a surprising passion for perfumes. Teammate Axar Patel shared that Bumrah is deeply involved in understanding perfume composition. Bumrah even gifted a perfume to Siraj after a match. Patel also received a perfume gift from Bumrah. These anecdotes reveal a lighter side to the formidable bowler off the field.

title: Jake Paul & Jutta Leerdam net worth 2025: Olympics, boxing, business
content: Power couple Jake Paul and Jutta Leerdam boast a combined net worth of $205 million in 2025.  Paul's wealth stems from boxing and business ventures, while Leerdam's comes from Olympic speed skating and sponsorships. Both are actively pursuing their respective careers, with Paul recently engaging in high-profile boxing matches and Leerdam preparing for upcoming international events.

title: Brittany Mahomes looks past Chiefs struggles; praises Patrick‚Äôs off-field impact
content: Patrick Mahomes' 15 and the Mahomies Foundation is making a significant community impact, with partner Youth Volunteer Corps reporting over 92,000 volunteer hours and $3.2 million in community benefit. Brittany Mahomes actively supports these efforts, highlighting the foundation's growing influence beyond football.  The foundation's initiatives, like Read for 15 and Volunteer for 15, foster positive development in young people.

title: 'I let Andy Reid down during Chiefs' tough season': Travis Kelce
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection: Film breaks 'Pushpa 2' record to score highest 4th week collections
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office dominance, shattering records even in its fourth weekend. The film garnered an impressive Rs 57.75 crore over the weekend, pushing its total net collection to an estimated Rs 690.50 crore.  'Dhurandhar' has now secured the highest fourth-week collection for any Hindi film, surpassing 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2'.

title: 'Parivar coming together‚Äô: NCP announces alliance with Sharad Pawar faction; seat-sharing pact soon
content: NCP chief Ajit Pawar has officially declared that his party and NCP (SP) will unite for the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation elections.  Addressing a rally, Pawar confirmed the alliance, stating it's a family coming together for the greater good of Maharashtra. Seat-sharing details are expected within two days, signaling a significant political consolidation.

title: Ravens-Steelers on SNF to cap Week 18 slate
content: The NFL announced the full final-weekend schedule, with the marquee matchup between the Ravens and Steelers set to take place on "Sunday Night Football" on NBC, with the winner making the playoffs.

title: Kawhi puts up career-high 55 for streaking Clips
content: Kawhi Leonard scored a career-high 55 points as the Clippers extended their winning streak with a victory over the Eastern Conference-leading Pistons.

title: Pats clinch AFC East; Bills' reign ends with loss
content: The Patriots clinched their first division title since 2019 on Sunday, dismantling the Jets behind Drake Maye and then watching the Bills fall to the Eagles.

title: Garrett: Steelers' focus more on me than winning
content: Myles Garrett didn't set the NFL's single-season sacks record Sunday, but he believes the Steelers were more worried about preventing his record than getting the win.

title: Rivers: No regrets, even with Colts 0-3 in return
content: Philip Rivers says he has no regrets about unretiring even though the Colts have gone 0-3 in his starts.

title: Bills QB Allen aggravates foot; X-rays negative
content: Quarterback Josh Allen's right foot became sore once again during the Bills' loss to the Eagles on Sunday.

title: Tank talk rubs Raiders wrong way amid latest loss
content: Raiders players' displeasure regarding the talk of tanking hovering over the organization intensified after a 34-10 loss to the Giants on Sunday.

title: Pels' Alvarado, Suns' Williams suspended for fight
content: Pelicans guard Jose Alvarado was suspended two games, and Suns center Mark Williams received a one-game suspension for their roles in a fight during the third quarter of Saturday night's game.

title: üëÄ How to do two coaching jobs during the CFP
content: Multiple CFP teams have coordinators taking head jobs elsewhere. For them, it's about compartmentalizing the chaos.

title: Tyler Shough for Rookie of Year? The Saints' QB is making his case
content: Sunday's win marked the fifth for the New Orleans signal-caller in just his eighth game as a starter.

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (22!), Broncos' D (64!)
content: The Browns' vet edge rusher and Denver's defense have one week to rewrite the single-season sacks record book.

title: Despite red zone issues, Jaguars are one win from AFC South title
content: After a close win at the Colts, the Jaguars need a victory against the Titans in Week 18 to secure the division title.

title: Week 17 winners and losers: Maye, Henry shine in fantasy finals; Gibbs, Lamb disappoint
content: Drake Maye, Derrick Henry and Chase Brown came up big when it mattered most in Week 17, while Jahmyr Gibbs and CeeDee Lamb were among the biggest disappointments.

title: 'Thank you Browns': Ravens give shoutout to rival for saving season
content: Baltimore now controls its division fate after Cleveland stunned Pittsburgh -- and the Ravens made sure to say thanks.

title: Ian Darke's Best XI: Who stands out halfway through the season?
content: Will it be Donnarumma or Raya for best goalkeeper? Which two Sunderland players are in? Here are the season's top players as we near the halfway point.

title: Despite leading the league, Arsenal haven't looked convincing
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for the fourth-straight game and their win vs. Brighton saw them do just enough.

title: The winner takes it all: Inside NFL division battles at the sportsbooks
content: At least two NFL divisions will be contested for during Week 18 of the NFL season after a wild Week 17.

title: Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

title: A new United States champ; Three Stages of Hell for Rhodes vs. McIntyre
content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye AZ midfielder Smit
content: Could Real Madrid sign the latest young talent straight out of the Dutch league? Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Tiger Death In Madhya Pradesh Pushes Year's Toll To Highest Since 1973
content: Another tiger death has been reported from Madhya Pradesh, pushing the total number of tiger fatalities to the highest ever recorded in a single year since the launch of Project Tiger in 1973.

title: Pawars Reunite For Polls: Inside The Family Feud And Its Aftermath
content: More than two years after they went their separate ways, Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar-led factions of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) are joining hands for the Pimpri-Chinchwad municipal elections.

title: "Spent 8 Years In Jail": Ex-Top Court Judge On Unnao Rape Convict's Bail
content: According to the former top court judge, the rape convict has already spent over eight years in jail, and he cannot be given a life sentence as he is "not a public servant".

title: 3 Months, 3 Oceans: How Chinese Ship Travels 37,000 km To Deliver Cranes
content: After more than three months at sea and crossing three oceans, the vessel docked at the Port of Kingston in Jamaica in October.

title: Opinion: Opinion | 2025: A Reform Year That Put Middle Class, Common Citizens First
content: The year 2025 stands out as a landmark in India's reforms journey-one that decisively placed the middle class and the common man at the heart of policymaking.

title: "Need Of World" Is That India Becomes 'Vishwa Guru': RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday called upon Hindus to work towards making the Hindu society and India a 'Vishwa Guru' for the welfare of the world.

title: "80 Drones, 36 Hours, Airbase Attacked": Pakistan's Big Op Sindoor Admission
content: The Pakistani government has acknowledged, for the first time in detail, the impact of India's strategic and precision strikes on its military installation under Operation Sindoor in May.

title: 'Raita' Made From Milk Of Dog-Bitten Buffalo Sparks Alert In UP Village
content: Nearly 200 residents of Piprauli village in UP got rabies vaccination as a precautionary measure after they discovered that the raita they consumed at the funeral was made from the milk of a buffalo that died after being bitten by a dog.

title: Chinese Military Stages Drills Around Taiwan To Warn 'External Forces'
content: The drills came after Beijing expressed anger at US arms sales to the territory and a statement by Japan's PM, Sanae Takaichi, saying its military could get involved if China were to take action against Taiwan.

title: Trump Asked If He Would Visit Ukraine To Ease Russia Tensions. What He Said
content: US President Donald Trump has insisted that peace negotiations aimed at ending the Russia-Ukraine war were "closer than ever before" following what he called a "terrific meeting" with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky at his Mar-a-Lago residence

title: Suriname Man Goes On Stabbing Spree After Fight With Wife, Kills His 4 Children
content: A man stabbed to death nine people, including five children, overnight in Suriname's capital Paramaribo, police said Sunday, adding the suspect was wounded and arrested.

title: 2-Year-Old Girl Among 6 Killed In Beachside Shooting In Ecuador
content: Multiple gunmen killed six people on Sunday, including a two-year-old girl, after shooting up a beachside boardwalk in southwestern Ecuador, police said.

title: In A First, South Korea To Allow Public Access To North Korea's Main Newspaper
content: South Korea said Friday it will reclassify North Korea's long-banned state newspaper as general information, easing public access, in the latest overture from the administration of dovish President Lee Jae Myung.

title: Pilot Dead, Another Critically Injured As 2 Helicopters Crash Midair In US
content: The Federal Aviation Administration described the crash as a midair collision between an Enstrom F-28A helicopter and Enstrom 280C helicopter over Hammonton Municipal Airport.

title: 2 Train Coaches With 158 Passengers Catch Fire In Andhra, 1 Killed
content: A man was killed after two compartments of the Tatanagar-Ernakulam Express caught fire at Yalamanchili, about 66 km from here, a senior police official said on Monday.

title: 16 Dead In Fire At A Retirement Home In Indonesia
content: A fire at a nursing home on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi killed more than a dozen people, with three others injured, a local official said Monday.

title: Delhi Cops Arrest 5 After Video Of Them Doing Stunts On Road Goes Viral
content: The Delhi Police has arrested five people after registering an FIR in connection with a viral video that showed a group of men performing dangerous stunts in speeding cars on Delhi roads, an official said on Sunday.

title: 'Parivar Together': Pawars Reunite For Pimpri-Chinchwad Civic Polls
content: Elections to 29 municipal corporations across Maharashtra, including the Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune civic bodies, will be held on January 15.

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Conner Weigman's four TDs help lead Houston to victory
content: we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . a lot of that had to do with the play of QB Conner Weigman . his favorite target was Tanner Koziol .

title: Graziano overreacts to NFC South, AFC North, Patriots, and Lions
content: the Texans' defense is going to be unbeatable in the playoffs . a spicy week 18 is set up with two division titles and two 1-seeds on the line . the stuff we're reacting to this week seems highly consequential .

title: Matthew Stafford vs. Drake Maye: Inside the odds, betting for the NFL's MVP race
content: quarterbacks Matthew Stafford and Drake Maye lead the pack for the award . the 37-year-old has a commanding -360 odds lead to win the award, according to draftKings . he started the campaign with +3500 odds to earn the NFL's highest individual honor .

title: Why Laveranues Coles decided to give up his cushy retired life to become an officer
content: laveranues Coles was approached by an elderly woman, a shopper walking to her car . she had no idea he was one of the NFL's most productive wide receivers from 2000 to 2009 . "i feel safe with you here," she told Coles .

title: Where did the Staubach-Pearson 'Hail Mary' football end up after 50 years?
content: the cowboys beat the Vikings in their 1975 playoff game . it was purported to be the quarterback's touchdown pass from Roger Staubach . he has long wanted a game-worn jersey of a Cowboys' Ring of Honor member .

title: Grading coaching hires: Kyle Whittingham, Michigan agree to deal
content: the wildest college football coaching cycle -- perhaps ever -- has reached the hiring phase . watch your favorite events in the newly enhanced ESPN App . sign up now New hires always come with hope and optimism, grand proclamations and the chance to get programs on right track .

title: The good, bad and ugly of Week 17: Big wins for Niners, Eagles, but what happened to Steelers, Bucs and Packers?
content: texans beat the Chargers to clinch a third consecutive playoff berth for the first time in franchise history . quarterback Derrick Henry carried the Ravens to victory over the Packers . the 49ers missed their chance to win the AFC North by losing a low-scoring affair to the Browns .

title: 'Da Niners': 49ers' virtual jabs at Bears lead NFL trolls
content: San Francisco 49ers beat the Chicago Bears 42-38 in a high-scoring "Sunday Night Football" matchup . quarterback Brock Purdy had 303 passing yards and accounted for five touchdowns . 49ers will face the Seattle Seahawks in week 18 for the NFC's no. 1 seed . the 49ers put a 49ers jersey on a Build-A-Bear .

title: Two youths arrested for sexually abusing minor at rented flat in Kerala‚Äôs Kozhikode
content: Police sources said the two reportedly took the girl to rented flat offering food and free stay on Sunday. She was later drugged and sexually abused

title: Adityanath orders closure of schools across Uttar Pradesh till January 1 amid cold wave
content: ‚ÄúThe safety of children is paramount during the cold wave, and any negligence in this regard will not be tolerated,‚Äù says UP CM Adityanath

title: Alaknanda: Indian astronomers spot implausibly old spiral galaxy
content: Alaknanda‚Äôs existence poses a significant puzzle for astronomers: it took shape when the universe was only about 1.5 billion years old, defying current models of galaxy formation. According to one expert, either the galaxy grew steadily by drawing in cold gas or it interacted or merged with a smaller companion galaxy

title: Real estate development opened up by Rajasthan's double-engine govt to hurt Aravallis more: Congress
content: "It is not just mining but real estate development that is being opened up by the double-engine sarkar in New Delhi-Jaipur against the recommendations of the Forest Survey of India," Mr. Ramesh said in a post on X

content: As per the FIR, a reel was posted on the Instagram account named ‚ÄòRed Army Kannur‚Äô showing visuals of a country bomb explosion

content: The survivor said she was hopeful of justice from the Supreme Court but questioned the delay in the CBI‚Äôs intervention

content: The case is titled as 'In Re: Definition of Aravalli Hills and Ranges and Ancillary Issues'; CJI-led Bench will hear the suo motu plea

title: Chhattisgarh: ED conducts raids in Bharatmala project land acquisition case
content: The case pertains to alleged irregularities in the payment of compensation for the acquisition of land for the Raipur-Vishakhapatnam economic corridor

content: Angel Chakma, a student from Tripura who was severely assaulted in Dehradun, the capital of Uttarakhand, and later died in the hospital

content: According to South Central Railway officials, coach numbers B-1 and M-2 were engulfed in fire and were badly damaged

title: Homo opportunisticus: The contingent, contested evolution of caste
content: Text of a guest lecture by writer Tony Joseph at the 84th annual session of the Indian History Congress at Government Brennen College in Thalassery, Kerala.

title: The man who wore an IAS mask
content: Lalit Kishor faked being an IAS officer, allegedly spending ‚Çπ5 lakh a month on convoys and staff to take bribes from at least 40 people across four States while promising them government jobs and contracts. Amarnath Tewary visits his family in Bihar, who lives in poverty, and speaks about his early aspirations

title: Amit Shah's arrival in Guwahati postponed as his flight cancelled due to dense fog
content: Except for the night halt, the schedule of his programmes remains unchanged, one of the officials said

content: According to the health department, no disease has spread in the village so far, and the situation is completely normal.

title: Haryana Police draws up an expanded crime and security strategy for 2026 with a focus on violent offenders
content: The DGP directed the Special Task Force (STF) to maintain a live watchlist of 100 violent offenders across the State

content: Modern mobility is not defined by infrastructure scale, but by access, affordability, and last-mile quality¬†

content: An aviation source said the 186-seat all-economy class Airbus A320 services will be linked to the first phase of the Navi Mumbai airport‚Äôs operational hours, from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.

title: Watch: Pakistan President Zardari reveals he was advised to ‚Äòhide in a bunker‚Äô during Operation Sindoor
content: Pakistan President Asif Ali Zardari has revealed that he was advised to hide in a bunker when India launched Operation Sindoor in May. Speaking at an event marking the 18th death anniversary of former Prime Minister Benazir Bhutto, Zardari recalled the tense moments during the India-Pakistan military escalation and praised Army chief Asim Munir‚Äôs response.

content: R. K. Jain says migration shaped by political and cultural factors, and not economics alone, remains central to understanding social inequality

title: Winter bird count conducted in Vellore and nearby districts
content: Forest officials said most of the habitats in these districts are home for local birds that migrate within specified areas round the year

title: What election rules miss about shadow campaigns in India
content: An analysis of digital political advertisements during the Bihar Assembly election shows that third-party actors outspend official parties and candidates and achieve far greater visibility; this creates an accountability gap, allowing opaque funding and influence to persist beyond regulatory oversight

title: S. Krishnaswamy, master chronicler of subcontinental history
content: His magnum opus, the four-hour-long film traversing 5,000 years of subcontinental history, ‚ÄòIndus Valley to Indira Gandhi‚Äô, was released in December 1976.

title: Bengal SIR: Many permanently shifted, untraceable voters in Matua-dominated seats, says study
